name: Saif Omar Al-Hara
title: Software Engineer
summary: Enthusiastic and skilled Software Engineer specializing in ASP.NET development, eager to apply a strong academic foundation and practical experience to new challenges. Adept at problem-solving and collaborative teamwork, passionate about crafting efficient and scalable software solutions.

experience.description: Develop and maintain enterprise insurance systems using ASP.NET Core 8 and Blazor, designing RESTful APIs and managing integrations.
bullets: Develop and maintain insurance systems with ASP.NET Core 8 and Blazor
Design RESTful APIs and integrate with payment gateways, government services, and internal platforms
Utilize Entity Framework Core, ADO.NET, and SQL Server; write optimized stored procedures and queries
Deploy and configure applications on IIS; ensure high availability and performance
Implement CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment
Apply clean architecture, dependency injection, and async programming for scalable code
Collaborate with QA, Business Analysts, and Operations to deliver secure, user‑friendly solutions
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize performance, logging, and error handling

experience.description: Designed and maintained web applications using ASP.NET Core 8 and Entity Framework Core with clean, scalable architecture.
bullets: Implemented RESTful APIs and HTTP Client communication for internal integrations
Built responsive front‑end components using SyncFusion Blazor
Managed complex database operations via ADO.NET and SQL Server (procedures, functions, queries)
Applied DI, Repository Pattern, and async programming for maintainability and performance
Published and maintained apps on production servers; monitored performance and logs
Collaborated using Git and agile practices; emphasized security, validation, and robust error handling

projects.name: HashBus
projects.description: A multi-app system to streamline university bus transportation: student Android app for ticket reservation and journey planning with live tracking; driver Android app for schedules, routes, and location updates; organizer web app to manage routes and users; admin dashboard for system data; Spring Boot REST APIs powering all apps. Built for scalability and efficiency to reduce congestion and improve travel times (Oct 2023 – Dec 2023).
